intro: Geostachys megaphylla, commonly known as the large-leaf geostachys, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color, which bloom during the wet season. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
